lead_paragraph: It is unclear what will happen the next time the government tries to force Apple to break into one of its own phones.

headline.print_headline: Unanswered Questions as an iPhone Case Fades
headline.main: In Apple Debate on Digital Privacy and the iPhone, Questions Still Remain

snippet: It is unclear what will happen the next time the government tries to force Apple to break into one of its own phones.
abstract: Justice Dept's announcement that it was able to unlock iPhone used by shooter in San Bernardino, Calif, terrorist attack has dissolved hopes for legal case that could have set critical precedents in heating battle over digital privacy; while relieved that Justice Dept has dropped case against Apple, privacy advocates are also expressing alarm that agency was able to crack company's gold-standard encryption codes.
